newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka Vanik plans debenture issue.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka Vanik plans debenture issue.

text.p: Sri Lankan investment bank Vanik Incorporation Ltd said in a statement on Tuesday that it plans to launch a debenture issue of 150 million rupees at a par value of 100 rupees.
"Vanik has always maintained that it will tap the debt market to raise money for fund-based activities," Justin Meegoda, chief executive of Vanik, told Reuters.
The company issued 600 million rupees of debentures at a par value of 100 rupees and a coupon rate of 20 percent in 1996. The issue was undersubscribed and Vanik raised only 150 million rupees.

"The coupon rate of the current issue will be nowhere near 20 percent, and will be decided before we submit the offer document for approval to the Colombo Stock Exchange and Securities and Exchange Commission," Meegoda said.
The coupon rate will be in line with falling interest rates, he said.
Sri Lanka's benchmark 12-month Treasury Bill rate was at 13.48 percent, compared to a high of 19 percent in 1996.
Vanik shares were trading at 14 rupees on Tuesday.
